reviews.review_msg: Ian rocks

Ian was an awesome teacher. he was very into what he was doing. although he didnt mark the midterm, final or term project my TA Elizabeth was amazing. she was very helpful and responded to emails and office hours always available!! best teacher i had so far and best class i had so far for a geo major

Ian is a funny prof but his TAs this semester were anal markers.  Exam questions were all essay format and too general, marks are hit or miss.  Project was somewhat fun.  Gotta go to tutorial to get marks.

Ian's awesome.  My favourite prof by far at SFU.  He's really  loves what he's doing and it really passes on to students.  He keeps his classes fun and engaging.  The text book is not necessary, but good for a reference
great lectures, with nice powerpoint slides. He was very clear with what is expected of you, and if you do just that you can do very well!

What a sweet guy. Very organized with his lectures, slides were printed out in a book for us to purchase. Explained everything really well at a level we could understand.  However, hes very much a 'grandpa' and having lectures at 10:30 on a friday make class very sleep worthy. Make sure to drink your coffee!! No midterm and easy/fun term project!
Overall pretty intense course but very important material for geography majors.  Exams were easy and the marking was fairly easy for the paper.  Highly recommended course!!
I was annoyed at how this guy took so many geeky jabs at pre-Lyellian scientists who thought the earth was only a few thousand years old. Ian, you're an enlightened man. Get over it!
Very good prof.  Great presentations.  It's just sometimes it's hard to know what he's expecting.
He sucks. He is stuck up and self centered. I hate his attitude and he takes marks off without any rationale. I think he makes sure to fail a certain amount of people each semester.

he's passionate and interested about his topic, which is awesome.. However.. this semester he decided that the TA's marked our term papers too generously.. so he revamped all the marks and lowered everyone by at least 2 marks.. very crappy.. it was unfair and unwarranted.. he's an okay teacher
A great course.  Lots of interesting material and overall it's easy.  Knows a lot.
Very good prof.  Very organized and slides are well-prepared. Good lecturer and interesting course material

Here's three cheers for Ian. I took quite a few classes from him, and found his style verye njoyable, while most of the time was not oriented towards the subject matter. You myst love Powerpoint and Comic Sans MS font. He let me make up a midterm once.:)
A challenging but fair course.
This course is a bad grade waiting to happen.

Wanna bad grade? Take this guy.  Tutorials are a total waste of time and have nothing to do with lectures.  Marking is not conducted fairly.The prof and the TAs mark your paper and then all give you inconsistent marks.
Very organized. Lectures flow and he covers a lot of material. Marks are split fairly well. Enjoys the subject material and is willing to share his knowledge. Clear and concise.

Great lectures, tutorial, and midterm. Final exam is retarded, 3 essay questions. If you know everything in the course except for those three topics you are screwed.  Beware, I got an A in tutorial and an A+ in the midterm and still only got C+ overall.
Great Professor! He is very organize and concise. His exams are quite difficult though.
ah, he's a good guy. (nice accent????!????)
No Comments
final exams are questionable, have to know everything to get good marks
tough final i would say not enough time only 2 hours/3 essays..
Awesome Prof! you'll love his class!
Remember bring tons of paper for his lecture, no overhead, tough exam
goes a little overboard with the power point but gets the point across
he's an excellent proff... just make sure you listen and go
Very clear and organized, interesting lectures, English accent
good lecturer...but hard exams
good lecturer, nice accent!
